p: Uracil (63.0 mg, 0.562 mmol, 2 equivalent) and 2 (162.7 mg, 0.281 mmol, 1 equivalent) were dried under high vacuum in separate round bottom flasks for 2 h. Under N 2 (g) and stirring, we added dry acetonitrile (2 mL) to uracil followed by the addition of bis(trimethylsilyl)acetamide (550.1 µL, 2.250 mmol, 8 equivalent). The reaction mixture was refluxed at 80 °C for 1 h then cooled to 0 °C. Then, compound 2 in dry acetonitrile (2 mL) was added to the reaction mixture followed by tin (IV) chloride (229.9 µL, 1.968 mmol, 7 equivalent) and heated to 60 °C for 3 h. The reaction mixture was poured into a separatory funnel containing ice cold water, extracted 3 times with ethyl acetate, and the combined organic layer was dried over anhydrous sodium sulfate. The reaction mixture was purified using flash chromatography (0 to 100% ethyl acetate in hexane gradient) to afford purified product; (89.4 mg, 0.153 mmol, 54.6%) 1H NMR (400 MHz, CDCl 3): δ= 9.22 (s, 1H), 8.09 (m, 4H), 7.86–7.82 (m, 2H), 7.63–7.56 (m, 2H), 7.63–7.56 (m, 6H), 7.29–7.21 (m, 2H), 6.65 (s, 1H), 6.12 (dd, 1H, J = 17.5, 11.1 Hz), 6.04 (d, 1H, J = 5.2 Hz), 5.64 (dd, 1H, J = 8.2, 2.1 Hz), 5.46–5.40 (dd, 2H), 4.94 (dd, 1H, J = 12.3, 3.2 Hz), 4.81 (dd, 1H, J = 12.3, 5.7 Hz), 4.66 (td, 1H, J = 5.5, 3.2 Hz)
